line_1: But when the wiry net his flight confines,
line_2: He lowers his purple crest, and inly pines;

line_1: And 'twixt the pressing Sides his Prey confines.
line_2: His closing Shells the Nacre sudden joyns.

line_1: But one dear object every wish confines,
line_2: And shall the sun, that now so cheerful shines,

line_1: Nor Earth thy Sov'reign Pow'r confines;
The sea no more its swelling surge confines,
line_2: While the loud equinox its pow'r combines,

line_1: Nor Rhime, nor Tune, nor Sacred Sense confines
line_2: The Spirit, Freedom flows in tuneful Lines,
Less sacred far those tinsel shrines,
